item.description:
Women are far less likely to be hit by lightening than men are.   Is this due to difference in the female brain? Or is the male brain just better at conducting massive amounts of electricity?  ;-)

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Does our brain have gender?

 

Are men better at some things due to gender differences than women? Do women read faces better than men, and is this due to brain differences?

 

Do women make for better spies?

 

In what ways does your brain function differently if you are female vs. male? How do gender differences in the brain impact society? What purpose does having female or male brains  serve?

 

What sort of influence, postive and negative, do brain gender differences have on relationships between guys and gals?

 

By understanding in what ways our brains may have gender differences, such aas due to the various influence of estrogen, testosterone and oxytocin, can we improve our relationships in the workplace, in society in general, etc?

 

Let's explore the gender and the human brain.

 

Note: the date for this discussion is subject to change.
item.how_to_find_us: Note: Date Suject To Change. Large table all the way in back
item.name: The Female Brain
